abstract: An atomic oxygen beam apparatus that produces flux levels and atomic kinetic energy similar to that encountered by spacecraft in low Earth orbit (LEO) is described. The beam apparatus consists of an electric discharge ion source, mass filter, decelerator, and neutralizer. Specific design goals include a 1.3 cm beam diameter, a 5 eV beam energy, and a flux density on the order of 10(15) cm(-2) s(-1). The total fluence will be on the order of 10(19) cm(-2) for an 8 hour test. The neutral oxygen beam will expose various materials contained within a large target chamber. Within the chamber will be a rather complex suite of instrumentation that will allow real-time studies of material mass loss and reactant species spatial distribution. In addition, a UV solar simulator will aid in the understanding of various synergistic effects.
title: Martin Marietta atomic oxygen Low Earth Orbit (LEO) simulation

organization.name: Jet Propulsion Lab., California Inst. of Tech.
Jet Propulsion Lab., California Inst. of Tech.

publications.publicationName: Proceedings of the NASA Workshop on Atomic Oxygen Effects
